item.title: If We Pay Attention
item.description: If We Pay Attention Bakarsak Zarif bir hüzündür bembeyaz dolaşan kuğuya bakarsak Mücevher titreşimleriyle mütereddit bir akşam suya bakarsak Fazlasıyla ısındı deniz kaynadı kaynayacak Dipten bir deprem yaklaşıyor suyun üzerindeki buğuya bakarsak Ne kadar yoksul ve çıplak görünürse görünsün ağaçlar O kadar yakındır ilkbahar özsuyu yürümüş dallara uğultuyla bakarsak Attila Ilhan

item.title: A Case Study on the Yocto Project
item.description: In this post, it’ll be tried to explain what is Yocto Project by building a real world example - a barcode reader. So let’s start! Introduction Following excerpt is taken from the Wikipedia article 1 on the Yocto Project. The Yocto Project is a Linux Foundation collaborative open source project whose goal is to produce tools and processes that enable the creation of Linux distributions for embedded and IoT software that are independent of the underlying architecture of the embedded hardware.

item.title: SciPowerLab Updated

item.title: Don't Regret Anything in Life
item.description: Don’t regret anything in life. If it’s good, it’s wonderful. If it’s bad, it’s experience! When you win, you win. When you lose, you learn. Richard Phillips Feynman

item.title: Getting Started Developing Qt with VS Code Development Containers as Simple as Possible
item.description: Disclaimer — This is just my humble opinion and maybe there is more convenient way out there for this purpose. For this purpose I already prepared a repo on GitHub1. The repo is a collection of some experimental works on AI, Image Processing, Qt Qml and embedded RPC. The procedure is is simple as follow. Requirements Any Linux Distribution (tested on Debian 11) with Wayland Display Manager Docker daemon VS Code with Remote Container extension.

item.title: A Collection Related FEMM Magnetic
item.description: The collection of FEMM software examples and Libraries can be cloned from as follow. 1 $ git clone https://github.com/ierturk/femm-magnetic-collection.git FEMM Finite Element Analysis Software is available freely from here1 The Collection BLDC Machine Analysis Generating animated images from FEMM solutions Java FEMM Link and Java PowerLab integration Java FEMM Link for acces to FEMM from Java programs SciCos FEMM Link. The SciCos is the predecessor of SciLab/XCos.

item.title: How Did We Get Here?
item.description: Before we decided to use a static website generator, we tried a few other ones like Thumblr, Ghost. Here is my experience with Ghost. Various open source tools and software was used to build our previous Ghost Blog site as follow. Tools and Platforms Digital Ocean Debian 11 Droplet Docker Containers Ghost Node JS blogging framework MariaDB database server nginx proxy server Let’s Encrypt SSL Key provider GitHub Remark42 Comment System How to Run All of procedure is explained on the GitHub1 repo README.
